clinical_study.brief_title: Daily Sleep Enhancement for Hospitalized People With Dementia Following a Nursing Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: Daily Sleep Enhancement for Hospitalized People With Dementia Following a 7 Step Nursing Protocol: a Quasi-experimental Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the daily performance of a 7 step bedtime nursing protocol for hospitalized people living with dementia is feasible and if it has an effect on bedtime and daytime variables.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily for up to 14 days from date of giving informed consent to hospital discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleeps through the night consistently, 5 point ordinal scale from "severe compromised" to "not compromised"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every second day for up to 14 days from date of giving informed consent to hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Subitem of the Outcome 'Sleep' from the Nursing Outcome Classification (NOC) Scale: severe compromised substantial compromised moderate compromised mild compromised not compromised

secondary_outcome.measure: Inappropriate napping, 5 point ordinal scale ranging from "sever" to "none"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every second day for up to 14 days from date of giving informed consent to hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Subitem of the Outcome 'Sleep' from the Nursing Outcome Classification (NOC) Scale: severe substantial moderate mild

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once in first three days after giving informed consent and another time 7 or 14 days later
secondary_outcome.description: Mini-mental-status-test score (range 0-30). Any score greater than or equal to 24 points (out of 30) indicates a normal cognition. Below this, scores can indicate severe (â‰¤9 points), moderate (10-18 points) or mild (19-23 points) cognitive impairment

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical performance measured with the Handgrip strength test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once in first three days after giving informed consent and another time 7 or 14 days later

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of drugs promoting sleep (sedative neuroleptics, hypnotics, sedative antidepressant in the time between 18:00-24:00) (nominal variable: yes or no)
secondary_outcome.description: Medical charts review for sedative neuroleptics (e.g. Quetiapine, Haloperidol), sedative antidepressives (e.g. Trazodon), hypnotics present (Benzodiazepines, benzodiazepine-like drugs) in the time between 18:00-24:00 (nominal variable: yes or no )

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical chart review for discharge domicile after hospitalisation (nursing home, home, other institution, other)

other_outcome.measure: Application frequency of the nursing (ritual) protocol
other_outcome.time_frame: Every day for up to 14 days from date of giving informed consent to hospital discharge
other_outcome.description: Daily protocol of the received and of the refused interventions of the nursing ritual (frequency)

arm_group.description: A 7 step nursing protocol. Each step is daily provided to the demented patient through a nurse by bedtime. Step 1: serve a late snack Step 2: evening care (brush teeth, get pyjama on, go to toilette) Step 3: note and treat physical circumstances that restrain sleep (pain, obstipation,...) Step 4: ensure comfortable position abed Step 5: assist to eliminate stressful situation (calm, reorientating conversation) Step 6: turn off the light Step 7: care for a silent environment (turn off Television, radio and "do not disturb"-sign at the door)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of dementia of any severity and type
- Allocation to geriatric rehabilitation treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- sleep related respiratory or moving related disorders or Parasomnia
- delirium
- end of life care
